default.$description: Base background colour for pages, cards and content.
Background colour for raised (card) UI surfaces.

prominent.$description: Background colour for prominent UI surfaces, interacted states or contextually important information.

default.$description: Basic border colour for dividers, cards, surfaces, etc.

prominent.$description: Prominent border color for dividers, cards, surfaces, etc.

gentle.$description: Softer border color for dividers, cards, surfaces, etc.

muted.$description: Subtle border colour for dividers, cards, surfaces, etc.

selected.$description: Border colour to highlight selected or active interactive elements such as checkboxes, menu items, utility buttons etc.

success.$description: Border colour to highlight content, interactive states or elements representing a successful action, response or interaction.

error.$description: Border colour to highlight content, interactive states or elements representing a failed, destructive or critical action, response or interaction.

warning.$description: Border colour to highlight content, interactive states or elements that communicate that a user should consider their response(s), and exercise caution in proceeding.

info.$description: Border colour to highlight content, interactive states or elements intended to inform or support a user.

brand.$description: Border colour to highlight or contain content to be linked to a brand's primary colour sentiment.

focus.$description: Border colour exclusively for use in highlighting a single, active interactive element when using keyboard navigation, screen readers, or other such accessibility or usability-driven methods.

basic.$description: Border colour for highlighting basic health insurance products.

bronze.$description: Border colour for highlighting bronze health insurance products.

silver.$description: Border colour for highlighting silver health insurance products.

gold.$description: Border colour for highlighting gold health insurance products.

hospital.$description: Border colour for highlighting hospital-only health insurance products.

extras.$description: Border colour for highlighting extras health insurance products.

combined.$description: Border colour for highlighting combined health insurance products.

default.$description: Primary, default foreground (text and icon) colour.

prominent.$description: Prominent foreground colour option for headings, small text or content that should otherwise maximise contrast against its' background.

gentle.$description: Softer foreground colour for supporting or secondary foreground content, such as text or icons.

muted.$description: Subtle (lowest contrast) foreground colour for supporting or tertiary foreground content, such as text or icons.

brand.$description: Foreground colour to highlight text or graphical content linked to a brand's primary colour sentiment.

sentiment.$description: Foreground colour to highlight text or graphical content linked to the primary colour sentiment of the context.

selected.$description: Foreground colour to highlight selected (or active) interactive elements or content, such as in contexts like checkboxes, radios, progress steppers, tabs or utility buttons.

label.$description: Foreground colour for labeling inputs, content or individual elements of content or interactivity.

success.$description: Foreground colour to highlight content representing a successful action, response or interaction.

error.$description: Foreground colour to highlight content representing a failed, destructive or critical action, response or interaction.

warning.$description: Foreground colour to highlight content that communicates that a user should consider their response(s), and exercise caution in proceeding.

info.$description: Foreground colour to highlight content intended to inform or support a user.

2xl.$description: Default foreground colour for page titles or extra-large headings (often but not exclusively corresponding to H1 in common HTML markup).

xl.$description: Default foreground colour for section titles or extra-large headings (often but not exclusively corresponding to H2 in common HTML markup).

lg.$description: Default foreground colour for large content headings (often but not exclusively corresponding to H3 in common HTML markup).

md.$description: Default foreground colour for medium content headings (often but not exclusively corresponding to H4 in common HTML markup).

sm.$description: Default foreground colour for small content headings (often but not exclusively corresponding to H5 in common HTML markup).

xs.$description: Default foreground colour for extra-small content headings (often but not exclusively corresponding to H6 in common HTML markup).

default.$description: Default foreground colour for hyperlinks in a default, inactive state.

hover.$description: Foreground colour for hyperlinks in a hovered (or focused) interactive state.

active.$description: Foreground colour for hyperlinks in a selected, pressed and/or active state.

disabled.$description: Foreground colour for hyperlinks in a disabled, non-interactive state. Does not need to pass WCAG2.1 AA contrast.
